Former Vice President Mike Pence is headlining a primary election-eve campaign event next week for Governor Brian Kemp, who is facing a Trump-backed primary challenger in former Senator David Perdue.
Former President Trump has thrown his weight behind Purdue  the former president still harbors a grudge over Kemp for refusing to overturn the 2020 presidential election results in Georgia.
Kemp has been leading in polls, basing his campaign on his record as the incumbent and focusing on jobs and the economy and contrasts with the likely Democratic opponent Stacey Abrams.
Pence's endorsement also shows the extent to which he may be building his political capital in this year's midterm elections, signaling ambitions to run for the GOP nomination in 2024.
